ygData.subject: RE: Enchanters (gone a little off topic)
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, I just gave it a try (I could have been wrong, I have been before).  I was in NK and conjured up an animation, then tried to charm a passing shadow wolf.
ygData.messageBody:
Well, I just gave it a try (I could have been wrong, I have been before). I
was in NK and conjured up an animation, then tried to charm a passing shadow
wolf. I got the message "You can only have ONE pet at a time" and the shadow
wolf attacked and promptly died.

When did you see Mersinaz do this? Maybe it was something enchanters could
have done at one time, but it got nerfed.

Tinik

On Thursday, December 02, 1999 2:00 AM, Monica Bradlee
[SMTP:mbradlee@...] wrote:
> From: Monica Bradlee <mbradlee@...>
>
> Mersinaz had an animation then charmed the Undead Froglok Executioner because
> it
> had an axe and we used it to kill the cavalier, sadly I won neither random
> and
> misssed out on the axe and the apolets, of course I was the only warrior and
> the
> only on able to use the axe
>
> Efrieum
>
> Tekdruid wrote:
>
> > From: Tekdruid <Tekdruid@...>
> >
> > On Thursday, December 02, 1999 12:00 AM, Monica Bradlee
> > [SMTP:mbradlee@...] wrote:
> > > From: Monica Bradlee <mbradlee@...>
> > >
> > >
> > > On what someone else said about enchanters, Animations don't count as
pets
> > > so
> > > the creature dubbed "evil eye pet" is actually an animation not a pet,
> > > they
> > > just screwed up when the text wrote it
> > >
> > > Efrieum
> > > Level 35 warrior
> > > gonna have a pet and gonna name it Binky
> > >
> >
> > Actually, for players, animations do count as pets. I have tried many
> > times
> > (usually accidentally) to charm a creature while I had my animation, and I
> > got
> > that old familiar message.
> >
> > Tinik
> > Enchanter, Veeshan
> >
> >
>
>
